title: Efficient Energy Use
description: In 2023, Ireland achieved a GDP of $50.79 per kg of oil equivalent, showcasing its efficient energy use, one of the highest globally.

title: Low Transport Service Imports
description: Transport services accounted for only 1.47% of Ireland's service imports in 2023, indicating a minimal dependency on foreign transport services.

title: High Value in Other Manufacturing
description: In 2021, 94.33% of Ireland's manufacturing value added came from sectors other than textiles and clothing, highlighting a diversified manufacturing base.

title: Minimal Learning Poverty
description: Ireland had a learning poverty rate of just 2.33% in 2021, reflecting a strong educational foundation for primary-aged children.

title: Extended Primary Education Duration
description: Ireland offers an 8-year primary education duration as of 2023, providing a comprehensive early education system.

title: Minimal Maternal Mortality
description: With a maternal mortality ratio of 1 per 100,000 live births in 2015, Ireland ranks among the safest countries for maternal health.

title: High Consumption of Fixed Capital
description: In 2021, Ireland's adjusted savings for consumption of fixed capital was 34.64% of GNI, indicating significant investment in maintaining capital stock.

title: Negative Net Primary Income
description: In 2022, Ireland experienced a net primary income deficit of $150.27 billion, indicating more income was paid abroad than received.

title: Decline in Manufacturing Growth
description: Ireland's manufacturing sector saw a significant decline of 23.93% in value added growth in 2023, reflecting challenges in the industry.
